page.title: 03GENERAL SURVEY RAVENGLASS
page.content: This area lies on the Cumbrian coastal strip between the Irish sea and the central massif of the Lake District National Park in which the area is included. Ravenglass,built at the junction of the estuaries of the Irt, Mite and Esk,has been a settlement since Roman times and is still the main village for the area.Farming and tourism are important as sources of income and employment,but the main employer is British Nuclear Fuels at Sellafield and contractors on that site.The village school was closed in 1981 and the Primary school children are now bussed to Waberthwaite school (5mls).Secondary school children travel to Millom Comprehensive(15mls). The climate is warm and wet.The estuary forms an excellent harbour used by many small boats.
